input_text: I want to apply to ALU
target_text: Great! To apply to ALU: 1) Register on ALU's admission portal NOW at https://start.alueducation.com, 2) Complete personal details (name, age, nationality, academic history), 3) Provide financing information, 4) Submit and get admission decision within 1 week!

Perfect! The 4 quick steps are: 1) Start your application - Register on https://start.alueducation.com, 2) Let us get to know you - Complete personal/academic details, 3) Financing your education - Provide sponsor information, 4) Submit and get decision within 1 week!
Goodbye! We look forward to receiving your application.
Goodbye! We look forward to receiving your application.
The typical process is: application submission → document verification → assessments → interviews → offers. Response times vary, but you'll be notified via email. Check your portal for updates.
Hello! Welcome to African Leadership University (ALU) - crafting tomorrow's leaders through entrepreneurship and practical learning. How can I help you today?
For more information, contact our representative Sheila Bwiza at sbwiza@alueducation.com (Rwanda). ALU Rwanda Campus is located at Bumbogo, Kigali Innovation City, Next to Azam, Kigali, Rwanda.

ALU has campuses in Rwanda (Kigali), Mauritius, and South Africa. Contact Sheila Bwiza at sbwiza@alueducation.com for Rwanda admissions. Visit https://www.alueducation.com/contact for more information.
For visa assistance, please contact ALU admissions directly. Campus accommodation is available at ALU Rwanda and other locations. Visit the portal for housing information and applications.
Hi there! ALU is Rwanda's top choice for leading employers worldwide - 75% of our alumni get employed within 6 months earning $12k+ annually. How can I assist with your admissions questions?

input_text: I need to talk to an admissions officer
target_text: For more information, contact our representative Sheila Bwiza at sbwiza@alueducation.com (Rwanda). ALU Rwanda Campus is located at Bumbogo, Kigali Innovation City, Next to Azam, Kigali, Rwanda.

Required documents typically include: secondary school transcripts, national ID/passport, proof of English proficiency, a short mission statement (100-300 words), and recommendation letters. The exact list varies by intake — upload on https://apply.alueducation.com
Tuition costs: BSE & BEL approximately US$3,000 per year, IBT around US$4,000 per year. Additional costs for term/location. Visit https://www.alueducation.com for current rates.

input_text: What do I need to get admitted?
target_text: Entry requirements vary by country and program. ALU lists minimum secondary certificate/pass requirements and program-specific subject thresholds. Please share your country and qualification type so I can provide specific guidance.

input_text: How do I start an application?
target_text: Perfect! The 4 quick steps are: 1) Start your application - Register on https://start.alueducation.com, 2) Let us get to know you - Complete personal/academic details, 3) Financing your education - Provide sponsor information, 4) Submit and get decision within 1 week!

input_text: Can I apply with my qualifications?
target_text: Eligibility depends on your country and qualification. Tell me your country and exact certificate (e.g., Kenyan KCSE, A-levels, IB) and I'll check ALU's guidance — or you can upload your transcript and I'll run a pre-check.
Hello! Welcome to African Leadership University (ALU) - crafting tomorrow's leaders through entrepreneurship and practical learning. How can I help you today?

target_text: ALU has country-specific entry requirements. Tell me your country and highest qualification (e.g., A-levels, High School Diploma, IB, national certificates), and I'll provide guidance or help you check eligibility.
